title: (x) "Avoiding the obvious" rounded tech sans - Chevin {Stephen}
content:
I'm sure this is a pretty common typeface, but I can't remember its name. I tried WhatTheFont, but didn't get any useful out of it.

I found the attached sample on a website.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fontsample.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20100510011240/http:/typophile.com/files/fontsample.gif) | 1009 bytes |
author: Paul Bailey

comments.content: It's [Nick Cooke's](http://web.archive.org/web/20100510011240/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Nick%2520Cooke) [Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20100510011240/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000003). Not so common, actually, but picking up steam.

Good Jelmar, I'm glad ;^)

Paul, Which website BTW?

Nick Cooke

Thanks, Stephen.

Nick, that's a really nice typeface.

I'm sorry, I don't remember where I got it from. I think the site was linked from one of those CSS showcase galleries. I'll try to see if I can find it for you.
